comment.author: 39551838@N08
comment._content:
Looks like a shot towards the NE from Barrington down George Street. The WF Page Building on the left would be the current TD Building location...and the building just past Granville St, is the one that recently housed the Elephant and Castle (with the columns). The Building on the right (CPR Telegraph in the photo) still stands...I believe that's the Dennis Building. Take a street view on Google Maps...and zoom in a bit...you'll see it. I would guess it's taken in the WWI era given the Victory Bonds and "To Hell with the Kaizer" signs on the cars.
-Jeff Bishop @jbish

comment.author: 61232251@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/jeffbishop] Thanks, Jeff! That sounds about right to me... love the movement in this photo.

comment.author: 25919078@N05
comment._content: The photographer may have been sitting on the wall that surrounds the Parade Ground, along Barrington St. His angle seems a bit elevated above street level.

comment.author: 52283410@N02
comment._content: Just took a similar shot a few days ago from the middle of Grand Parade - very cool to be able to see this!
